intro: Drymonia ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian drymonia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and purple. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. It is often found in cloud forests and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
